title: The Law of Cognitive Phases (CPL): Formalizing Observer State Transitions in Subjective Physics
description:
Version 3.0 presents the Cognitive Phase Law (CPL)—a formal principle governing discrete state transitions in cognitive observers within the paradigm of Subjective Physics. The law defines three canonical phases — Cognitive Coherence, Cognitive Fragmentation, and Reorganization—based on observer entropy, projection stability, and entropy rate. Reproducible simulations (seed=42) validate predicted hysteresis, critical slowing, and path-dependent transitions, confirming cognition as a non-equilibrium system with quantifiable phase-space topology.

See also: Khomyakov (2025), Comment on Evans (2025), DOI:10.5281/zenodo.17469210
